intro: Linaria simplex, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Linaria simplex is often found in disturbed areas, roadsides, and open fields.
